content: Singaporean civil engineer **Phoon Kok Kwang** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 方國光; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Fāng Guóguāng*) is a Singaporean civil engineer, currently president of [Singapore University of Technology and Design](/wiki/Singapore_University_of_Technology_and_Design), formerly senior Vice Provost (Academic Affairs) at [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) and is the founding editor-in-chief of the [Taylor & Francis](/wiki/Taylor_%26_Francis) journal *Georisk*. He is also a Fellow of the [American Society of Civil Engineers](/wiki/American_Society_of_Civil_Engineers). He was also previously the Kwang-Hua Professor at [Tongji University](/wiki/Tongji_University). In 2017, Phoon received the [Humboldt Prize](/wiki/Humboldt_Prize). This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Phoon Kok Kwang
